website_summaries.verdict: The best electric chainsaw on the market. Powerful enough for all but the most demanding tasks.
pros: A high-performance corded chainsaw that's a match for gas models of a similar size
cons: Difficult to find problems or critics
The only negative is the price

customer_reviews.title: Saw works as advertised and is easy to assemble and it would probably be 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Saw works as advertised and is easy to assemble and it would probably be 5 stars. My issues with this saw relates to the oiler. It leaked all over my bench overnight and to finally stop it I had to find an o-ring to fit the cap. Overall I think the oiling system is a mess. It's in a relatively awkward place and you can't easily fill it without a funnel and the mess that goes with that. Fiddling with a messy chain oiler was one reason for getting away from gas saws. For the $250 I paid it should be designed better.
customer_reviews.author: Drdrbcat

customer_reviews.title: Loose
customer_reviews.text: After using it twice and being impressed at how smoothly it cut, the chain started coming off. After many tries, and viewing YouTube videos on how to tension the chain, I called Makita Technical Support: return it, I was told. Or, take it to a repair center. Since I had used it so little, and since the chain kept slipping off, I decided to return it. At the price I paid, it should work a lot better after being used just twice.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Carburetors
customer_reviews.text: While not quite up to gas standards, it does the job and only maybe takes 25-33% longer in the cut. If you have used a cheap electric, you know how it works, only this one is clearly more reliable in torque and quality. Biggest problem others have suggested is that not fueling makes one forget to fill the oil too... gotta remember somehow... hey Makita, at this price you could build in a little reminder LED based on power-up time. The grab guard could be engineered a little better too. BTW, I used this with the Honda 2000 inverter and it's been no problem whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Fraugher

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but well worth it
customer_reviews.text: I had a 35 ft pine tree come down in my backyard during a wind storm. This saw had enough power, together with a longer 18" bar, to reduce the tree into about 4500 lbs of manageable blocks to take to the dumps. Runs as new after the job ! Only problem I had was really from my fault in letting chain oil tank run empty, the chain tightened up stopped. Exercise due caution though. Do not let bar tip contact anything. Do not stand in its path IF it does kick back at you.
customer_reviews.author: P Lam

customer_reviews.title: Best Electric Chainsaw You Can Buy
customer_reviews.text: The chainsaw is great. Powerful. I own 2 other electric chainsaws (and 2 cordless) - none of them have the heft and power of the Makita. I prefer a gas chainsaw with respect to power but there are so many drawbacks: Needs fresh gas, mixing the 2 cycle oil and the always present chance the damn thing won't start. Spend a little extra and get a quality tool that will last forever. Only one small problem which I'm adjusting to: The chain tightening mechanism isn't as effective as I'd like but this is a problem inherent in every chainsaw I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: John Dulin

customer_reviews.title: Good option to have around
customer_reviews.text: Good amount of power with this electric chainsaw. Can't expect it to tear up logs like a gas powered one, but for the little of amount of storm cleanup or occassional shrubbery work, nothing beats taking out an extension cord and putting this Makita to the task. So tired of having to practically rebuild my gas Stihls, Craftsman and Echo chainsaws over the years just to fire them up. No mixed gas to go bad, just keep several sharpened chains on hand and saw away. Handled a good 12" spruce tree pretty good until the chain dug into the dirt.
customer_reviews.author: BigFoot

customer_reviews.title: best chainsaw I ever owned
customer_reviews.text: At first I was hesitant to go with an electric saw, but this electric one is as good as my decent gas saw, it is a great deal, no messing with fuel mixes, instant start, light, its so great to use. I love it so much I bought a 20" bar and an alaskan mill and I was able to mill small logs with it. You can't do that with low quality saws. The only annoying thing was the chain tensioner is crappy, I had to replace a part after some use, good news is they sell every part of this saw online for cheap so if you break something it is easy to service.
customer_reviews.author: Waffle Lover

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and quiet
customer_reviews.text: I have a Stihl MS250 chainsaw. It's awesome. So why did I buy this chainsaw? Because my Stihl is noisy, smoky, requires gas refills and sometimes is difficult to start. Basically, my Stihl is for big jobs, outside away from my neighbors. The Makita is quiet and doesn't put out any exhaust. The amazing this is that it is almost as efficient as my gas powered Stihl. I am truly impressed by the power of this saw. The fit and finish are up to the quality you would expect from Makita. It features a cool clip that keeps the saw from inadvertently becoming unplugged from an extension cord. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for an electric
customer_reviews.text: Impressive for an electric chainsaw (should be at this price). Uses standard bar and chain. Typical Makita industrial quality. Minor niggles - it just loves bar oil and there is no way to adjust the flow. The safety lock can get triggered without clear visual or tactile indications - thus, the saw does nothing but looks perfectly happy. You soon learn to jiggle the release bar a bit even though it looks like it is in the correct position. Before you start to disassemble it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Golub

customer_reviews.title: "YOUR SAW IS GOOD!"
customer_reviews.text: I got this after a bunch of oak limbs in the back yard fell during a windstorm- landlord was planning to trim them and then Nature beat him to it. His Ryobi gas and Ryobi electric chainsaws both died during the effort, so he had to ask to use mine. This chainsaw did 70% of the total work after the first 30% killed two lesser saws. Great saw, to the extent that if I had to use it in the country away from outlets, I'd just buy a generator rather than a gas saw.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent electric chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I've used tools to earn my living my whole life. When it comes to tools I'm a firm believer in the old saying of buy once, cry once. Buy the best tools you can afford. This is a quality tool that should last many years. This saw will not compare to a gas powered saw so don't be foolish thinking it will. It operates much slower than a gas saw. That said it works great for what it was intended for.
customer_reviews.author: tpollock

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazed at the power of this electric saw. This is my second day of using it and used it to cut 24" diameter pine logs in addition to about 1 cord of hardwood. I would have never believed an electric saw would cut so well. The chain that was provided was razor sharp. Only issue is removing the side support plate (which adjusts tension on the chain and chain blade) but once you remove it a few times for cleaning you get the hang of it. Would recommend ordering extra chain lubricating oil and an extra long extension chord. Very happy with chainsaw so far.
customer_reviews.author: Now I'm a Wiser Consumer!

customer_reviews.title: HELP!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I see by all the 4~5 stars, this must be an excellent chainsaw. I spent more time putting the chain back on, then cutting real thin maple trees! The chain is on right, I think, and I pulled it as tight as possible before putting the case back together. Can someone please help me to understand what I’m doing wrong???
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: my first electric. Better than my small gas saw.
customer_reviews.text: Been chainsawing for decades.. this one is great.. moved from rural country to small city and this is the least obnoxious option and it works very well, cuts perfectly- same rules apply... don’t cut dirt/rocks.. keep it sharp, swap out the chain as soon as cutting gets slow.. keep the chain oiled. Basic stuff. Very strong (for electric) machine. Have not tried it with a 2000w inverter generator yet.. great on a 12/3 x 50’ extension. Quiet, no stink.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Juno

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd bought this Years ago
customer_reviews.text: I've always had wood burning fireplaces for the past 30 years. And I've had a variety of 14-16 inch gas chain saws that were all difficult to start. Finally I broke down and bought an electric chain saw, choosing Makita for their reputation and good reviews. Now I'm kicking myself for spending years dealing with gas chain saws. This one is light, easy to handle and maintain, and, best of all, Starts Every Time. Sure, you can't take it into the woods to cut firewood but I don't do that. Within reach of an electric outlet for casual or maybe occasional serious work, this is one to have.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyB

customer_reviews.title: As a chainsaw virgin I had apprehension about cutting my ...
customer_reviews.text: As a chainsaw virgin I had apprehension about cutting my face off but I was able to cut up the 12" tree that fell down in our yard with relative ease. On an under cut it did kick back once and the safety off worked perfectly. This chainsaw has plenty of power for the casual use.
customer_reviews.author: Brad M

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should, feels durable, but heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Feels solid. Works good. So far it has gone through 6~7" diameter logs without a problem. I noticed it consumes less oil than some other brands, which is a plus. The quick stop/start feels dignified and solid. But it is pretty heavy. I take breaks after minute or two of cutting. But I can live with that. Can't have everything...
customer_reviews.author: Digiko

customer_reviews.title: Good Saw!
customer_reviews.text: I had an electric Craftsman for many years until I broke the case which is why I purchased this one. I must admit that this saw is very nice. It performed perfectly. Has plenty of power and you don’t have to worry about it not starting. These electric saws are well suited for home use because you don’t have to concern yourself with the fuel if not used frequently. I’m pretty confident that this saw could handle whatever task it was needed for.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD

customer_reviews.title: Does everything a chainsaw should do. I'll take a ...
customer_reviews.text: Does everything a chainsaw should do. I'll take a cord and slower cut versus the oil, gas, noise, fumes, starting issues, maintenance of a gas engine. I am an intermittent user for trimming,, small tree removal and slab/timber/sculpting wood working projects.
customer_reviews.author: John Lenio

customer_reviews.title: Cuts wood like butter, easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: This is all you could want in an electric corded chain saw. Cuts wood like butter, easy to handle, not too heavy, and circuitry built in so it can't burn out the motor. Like several electrics I have owned in the past. its wooderful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: # 1 rated electric chain saw.
customer_reviews.text: Quality made electric chain saw. Purchased after reading reviews. Worth the extra money.Made easy work of broken tree limbs from ice storm. Will come in handy year after year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliability at its best!
customer_reviews.text: I just realized 98% of my body aches while using a gas powered chainsaw (Salem Master) were cause to crank it up every time I need it to use it. With this, is like day and night. Very easy to use and get the chain saw tighten from time to time too. In a couple non-stop hours I did what with the gas type took me a full day (taking brakes). A really well made product! I recommend it !
customer_reviews.author: Hector Flores

customer_reviews.title: Its all I hoped.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a 10 year old 16 inch gas chainsaw with this because I wanted something easier to start. Oh it is so nice to start it with a button pull. Easy and simple. This more powerful and quieter. I don’t know if I should have gotten the battery version so I could go clear some trails in the woods. I may end up also getting the smaller battery one.
customer_reviews.author: Click Click

customer_reviews.title: Wow...
customer_reviews.text: I am not trying to be biased because I own so many Makita products but this thing blows away my gas powered saw, I don't ever use my gas one any more. granted, it isn't a Husqvarna but is a Poulan and I love this way better, why would you ever want to mess with gas if you have a power outlet? And also so quite compared to gas.
customer_reviews.author: Laserboy

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Little Guy
customer_reviews.text: This little chainsaw very quickly became my favorite tool! I had a large maple taken down at my house and wanted to keep it for fire wood. I was easily able to cut up the tree in more manageable sections to chop up. I also took down a few saplings and branches around the yard. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great, leaks oil like a sieve
customer_reviews.text: The Makita Chain Saw has at least as much power as my small gas chain saw and not having to mix and manage gas was the primary appeal. The chain is very sharp and cuts well. The saw is a bit heavier than its small size suggests. My only problem is that the chain lubricant drips out steadily and makes a mess.
customer_reviews.author: PhotonJunkie

customer_reviews.title: This is a great chain saw.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chainsaw. I used t to cut down 2 tree's in my yard. Works almost as good as a gas powered saw. You can stall it out but you have to really be forcing it to cut to do so. If you let the saw do the work, it's fast, efficient and won't stall. Don't waist your money on cheap electric chain saws, this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: American180

customer_reviews.title: Super great saw
customer_reviews.text: Way easier to use than a gas chain saw of the same power. Has great features like motor protection overload and automatic oiler with sight gauge. Chain tension was a bit difficult to work with to begin with but finally figured out an easy way to use it. For sure would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Al W

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative
customer_reviews.text: If you cut wood for the winter you should have this and a gas chanisaw. This porduct is extremely easy to use, lightweight and effective for everything near your power source. It works extremely well - obviously cannot cut as fast as a bigger more powerful chanisaw, but that is to be expected. It is lightwieght and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put together and maintain
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put on chain and tighten. You have to cut as lot for it to get hot and it cools off fast. Once pines get over 12" it takes significant effort to cut. Maybe chain was dull I'm not sure. Cuts through 10" or less like better. Can cut 8" oaks without problem as well
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Decided to go with this and couldn't be happier with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Rented a 60cc gas chainsaw from Lowe's for the day. Had nothing but problems with it. You also had to constantly add gas/oil to it. Decided to go with this and couldn't be happier with the purchase. It is much lighter to handle than gas chainsaw. If you need this for your backyard and have access to electric, I say go with this. I am able to cut through 20inch to 30inch tree trunks with this!
customer_reviews.author: Todd F.

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Feels solid, cuts great, better than a gas chainsaw if you can stay in the range of your cord! No hassle with gas mixtures and starting. Just pull the trigger and cut! I use a 75ft. 12/3 extension cord and can reach my cutting areas. Would not be good if I had to go off into the woods and cut down trees.
customer_reviews.author: Richard F.

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Finally got extensive use of the Makita Chain Saw, it just cuts and cuts, easy to "start" by pushing the power button and never "stalls" and gets the job done! Never have to be concerned about the gas mixture, just keep it plugged into the 15 amp electric extension cord. However, check the oil so as to not run the chain saw dry. What a relief!
customer_reviews.author: K. MCBRIDE

customer_reviews.title: Great Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I've easily cut down +30 foot trees with this chainsaw. I am also able to couple this to a portable 2 KW generator and still have full power. Way easier to use than a gas chainsaw. Keep an eye on the oil level as it does use it up quick, but it holds plenty to cut and section an entire "Large" tree. Much quieter than a gas chainsaw, and of course, starting is no issue. It also uses standard chains that can be sharpened using any generic chain sharpener.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rosinski

customer_reviews.title: ... around I cut down a 45 foot tree highly recommend this chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: His chainsaw don't mess around I cut down a 45 foot tree highly recommend this chainsaw
customer_reviews.author: Pablo S Cardenas

customer_reviews.title: ... front of my yard and it cuts through logs like butter. Excellent quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I just used this today with my 120ft + 50ft + 50ft extension cords to clear some trees from the front of my yard and it cuts through logs like butter. Excellent quality for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Anna G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance and rugged construction.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performance and rugged construction. Makita tools have always served me well. This saw is more expensive than similar products, but the performance, quality of construction, and professional level build are worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Steve L.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good electric chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: This saw cuts oak and locust logs up to 12 inches easily. I use it routinely for smaller branches used for kindling in my wood burning stove. The only issue I have is the oil fill reservoir is very hard to fill as it appears restricted just below the fill cap so it tends to overflow easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good chain saw
customer_reviews.text: Set up a bit of a challenge but after is set up it works well. Not bad for an electric chain saw. Handles the cutting of tree limbs up to its described specifications. Would recommend for small to medium jobs not for thicker limbs or heavy thick trees.
customer_reviews.author: especial

customer_reviews.title: Broke after less than 2 years...
customer_reviews.text: ...of occasional use around the house. Stopped from one second to the next, no idea what is wrong with it. Very disappointed, this should not happen. Worked well when it did.
customer_reviews.author: Halo

customer_reviews.title: Powerful for an electric
customer_reviews.text: Works well. A lot of power for an electric saw. Soft start takes time to get use to. It is a full load for a 2 kw inverter. Hog down too much and the inverter kicks out.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Nelsen

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: great product, but from actual experience i can say that this is good for small branches etc, but really struggles with decent size logs. NOT a replacement for a Stihl gas saw, but rather a good addition.
customer_reviews.author: Asok Patnaik

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy now I'm stuck with it
customer_reviews.text: This saw seems to be well made and sturdy but after paying a local shop to assemble it I found it was too heavy for me to safely use , so now I have an unused electric chain saw and 2 gallons of bar oil that I probably will never be able to resell and no way of packaging to return it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Power is great, comparable to gas.
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried that an electric chain saw would have enough power. This awesome saw went through a 24 inch ash tree with no problem at all! Had to cut one side, then go to the other because the tree was so big. The saw didn't bog down even once. Tightening the chain is a breeze - very good design. I'll never go back to messing with gas now...
customer_reviews.author: Mike T.

customer_reviews.title: Have owned for a year and couldn't be happier with this product ( for my use )
customer_reviews.text: Have owned for a year and couldn't be happier with this product ( for my use ). I use for light / medium tree trimming. Very convenient to use and easy to tighten chain tension ( which I check and tighten periodically when using ).
customer_reviews.author: DMC1943

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and quite strong. Amazing for an electric chainsaw. I particularly like having the motor behind the blade and not sticking out the side like other electrics. makes it easier to use in tight space.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L Klick

customer_reviews.title: Power + convenience
customer_reviews.text: When a tree fell in our backyard, I decided I needed a chainsaw to deal with it, but I want looking forward to the the prospect of yet another temperamental two cycle engine. For the 1-2 times I'll use this, is spend as much time keeping it running as actually running it. This Makita is great. All the benefits of an electric saw (instant start/stop, minimal maintenance), with every bit of power I could need. This thing ripped through 14+ inch wood like it was nothing. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Schroer

customer_reviews.title: This is the saw you are looking for
customer_reviews.text: Perfect saw for yard work near home, strong motor able to cut without stalling, easy to maneuver. I suggest you purchase the "US Wire 74100 12/3 100-Feet " extension cord if you do not own a long heavy duty cord, this saw will need the power.
customer_reviews.author: pam j shenko

customer_reviews.title: Ready Killowatt was righ... go electric!
customer_reviews.text: Works great once I got the chain lube primed... except for the slight oil leak. The chain feels moderately aggressive and is VERY easy to handle. The best part: no more gummed up gas carb.
customer_reviews.author: zoolane

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power
customer_reviews.text: This is one good saw. People told me not to get an electric cause it would loose power under a load. Well not this baby. Plenty of power to spare. My only complaint is that it's heavy but then if it wasn't it may not have done such a fine job. Nice saw Makita, and thanks.
customer_reviews.author: J. Geary

customer_reviews.title: this chain saw is in my opinion works just as good as a gas equivalent
customer_reviews.text: Have had Remington's, echo's, this chain saw is in my opinion works just as good as a gas equivalent!! I hemmed and hawed for either a 14 or 16 inch, went with the 16 for just a few bucks more, and was so worth it, cuts like fast and quick. The best part of this saw is the adjustable cover with no tools needed!!! Great job/ engineering!!
customer_reviews.author: Tractor Boy

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power and easy to use!!
customer_reviews.text: No more mixing gas. No more pulling & pulling & pulling to get it started!! Just plug it in and you’re sawing!! Love the way you can see how much oil you have! Easy to find extra chain and sharpener right at Lowe’s. Plenty of power to cut through larger trees even on the knots.
customer_reviews.author: rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Good quality electric chain saw.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, powerful enough to replace my finicky Stihl gas saw. But not an energy hog, so I can use it with a small portable gas generator to do tree work out in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: T. Shearer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent powerful saw.
customer_reviews.text: This saw is pretty powerful for a electric saw. I cut down a 70-year-old apple tree. Be careful not to cut through a hollow point that was filled with dirt it will dull your blade quickly. Besides that I like the saw a lot .did the job and more.
customer_reviews.author: Chainlink

customer_reviews.title: no more pulling the starter cord!
customer_reviews.text: As long as you follow instructions on using a 12 gauge extension cord, you will have no problems. Love this chainsaw is plug in and go. We have cut down trees that are about 18 inches diameter without any difficulty. Getting older and hate pulling start cords. This is exactly what is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Moon in Alabama

customer_reviews.title: Extremely good product
customer_reviews.text: This saw has some heft, but not too much. It will easily go through small to medium trees and branches. The instruction manual is not great, especially for newbies. A little time taken at the beginning is a small price to pay for a very useful tool.
customer_reviews.author: LaFong

customer_reviews.title: Fast cutting, quiet, clean
customer_reviews.text: Cuts easily with a sharp chain. Like any chain saw, requires periodic cleaning and adjustment, especially when cutting sap wet wood.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rettie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! Much quieter
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Much quieter, much less saw dust, almost as efficient, no gas mixing, no smells, and just overall a much more pleasant tool to work with!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TOOL
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace a no-longer serviceable Milwaukee Electric Chain Saw. Very happy with the Makita 16". Very easy to use and maintain. Two years, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: mp mcgrath

customer_reviews.title: makita  chainsaw  da best
customer_reviews.text: spent 400$ on a timber wolf echo chainsaw which doesn't start properly with 100s spent servicing it the makita chainsaw starts every time
customer_reviews.author: .Net learner

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: What a great piece of gear. Well thought-out, works great. Very pleased...:o) !
customer_reviews.author: S. Ring

customer_reviews.title: Good saw
customer_reviews.text: It works well as long as you don't expect the power of a gas powered saw. What it lacks in power (and therefore speed) it makes up for in ease of use. Just make sure it has oil and the chain adjusted, plug it in and go. No need to worry about mixing oil or flooded carbs.
customer_reviews.author: Oag357

customer_reviews.title: This chain saw was well worth buying!
customer_reviews.text: We were surprised how well this saw works. We cut down plenty of trees and 11 pick up trucks loads of brush. It did a excellent job!
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett O'Hara

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I don't have enough wood cutting around the house to justify all the work I needed to go through to keep my gas powered chain saw working - and it wasn't working when I needed it. This chainsaw doesn't come with the chain installed and I'm not mechanically inclined, so it took a little time to figure out how to get the chain on. There are some helpful videos on YouTube. But once that was done, the rest was easy - including cutting up the tree. It was actually fun. I was surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Tinkhard

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and effective.
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to my hubby. His old one was dying and it was too heavy for a man in his 80's. He no longer fells large trees but does quite a bit of trimming branches.He really likes this one.
customer_reviews.author: mombatt

customer_reviews.title: The best corded saw I've used but doesn't come with chain lube oil
customer_reviews.text: Quality. I've used less expensive chainsaws- a lot, and they work, but this thing is at a whole different level. Cuts like butter. It did not come with any chain lube oil so you can't use it out of the box which is kind of a no no in my book. Otherwise a great saw.
customer_reviews.author: All Outta Bubble Gum

customer_reviews.title: Pay abit not that homelite but way better saw completely differ in class and experience.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing powerful saw quality Oregon chain. Cuts through sweet gum maples like butter.
customer_reviews.author: MarkAllisonMc

customer_reviews.title: Very good electric saw
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with its functionality for the price. I'm sure gas power saw would have more power, but I am happy not to have to deal with gas and breath the fumes.
customer_reviews.author: W. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Well built, solid
customer_reviews.text: I'm really impressed with its power. I'm glad I spent the extra money for a high quality product. Really like the chain tightening feature. Putting bar oil in it is a little cumbersome though.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: exceeded expectations - perfect for small to medium jobs. Included instructions are terrible, so download them online.
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 cuts.
customer_reviews.text: I used the chainsaw for exactly five easy cuts and it stopped working. This item is suppose to be a premium product. What a waist of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Hornecker

customer_reviews.title: Makita chainsaw was not complete!  Please note!! My error-=- Saw was complete!!
customer_reviews.text: I expected the Makita chainsaw to come with a chain. I ordered an Oregon chain to have as an extra for backup. I did not get a Makita chain and I believe the chainsaw should have been complete and operational without ordering a chain separately. What happened?? MY APOLOGIES TO THE VENDOR! THE ORDER WAS NOT MAILED FROM ONE SOURCE AND THE SAW WAS INDEED COMPLETE. I SUBSEQUENTLY GOT MY EXTRA CHAIN! MY MISTAKE!!! THANK YOU
customer_reviews.author: Ken Vaillancourt

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This electric chainsaw meets my needs very well. I have used larger gas chain saws in the past and for larger duties they work very well, however as a homeowner that needs a chainsaw for smaller projects once or twice per year, this saw will be ready when needed no gas issues.
customer_reviews.author: Automation_Mgr

customer_reviews.title: good saw
customer_reviews.text: Used extensively after hurricane Michael. Worked like a charm. Went through downed oaks like butter. Was used in two weeks probably more than most saws in a year. Worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: donald hasty

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. Rated 120~. Works in countries with 240v supply without the need for a transformer.
customer_reviews.author: ae100lady

customer_reviews.title: As good as the brand name.
customer_reviews.text: Feels like a gas powered saw but starts every time with the pull of a trigger.
customer_reviews.author: REM

customer_reviews.title: great size
customer_reviews.text: works really well. Medium size for ease of use cuts through wood very easily
customer_reviews.author: Natalie A

customer_reviews.title: Works when you need it
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for clearing brush. Works well with power like my gas model. Great for clean up and maintenance after job is done. Also it was easy to tighten the chain as compared to other saws that I have used.
customer_reviews.author: P J

customer_reviews.title: Nice features.
customer_reviews.text: Soft start and handle position makes this saw very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: R. Berry

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Saw
customer_reviews.text: Love my electric saw. Never thought about buying one but it's light weight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: the main tag

customer_reviews.title: Very professional, gas models are out.
customer_reviews.text: This a much better product and worth the extra money. The saw cuts through wood like butter, the chain adjustment is a snap. Very professional, would recommend. Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: durang503

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great saw, does everything I need it to. Plenty of power, excellent build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Gozrula

customer_reviews.title: Could not be more pleased. Took down
customer_reviews.text: Bought tons of stuff from amazon never reviewed a thing. Until now. This saw is whack. Was worried about it being more toy than saw. Could not be more pleased. Took down, bucked up and hauled branches of a 40 foot tree yesterday like no gas saw I ever had. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile and well made!
customer_reviews.text: Great little saw! Tough as nails. More than handles the cutting tasks needed for maintaining my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Beaman

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: This little saw cuts like a champ, bought it to use at a campground because it’s quiet. I used it cut up two big locusts tree without a problem, the only thing I had to adjust was the chain Oiler. This little saw is a beast.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Haldeman

customer_reviews.title: Strong!
customer_reviews.text: Easily competes with gas ones. As long as you can manage the cable you'll be cutting wood without noise and stink.
customer_reviews.author: osie1

customer_reviews.title: No regrets trading in our gas chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: It is still pretty new, but so far, it's fantastic. Plenty of power to do around-the-yard cutting (we have 70 year-old pine and elm trees). Reliable, clean, and the need for a power cord has not been a limitation or an irritant to date. Our last gas chainsaw was a complete pita, and this has been the opposite of that so far.
customer_reviews.author: badcyclist

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Used it once and it broke. Window to return closed. Had I bought it at Home Depot I could still return it.
customer_reviews.author: RaBbiT

customer_reviews.title: Motor protection
customer_reviews.text: Best I have ever owned. I am a professional woodturner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I love this chainsaw. Doesn't cut big logs, is a lot slower than my gas powered chainsaw and the chain will wear out much faster than the gas chainsaw chain because it is working harder, but it does the job! It is quiet and doesn't have the vibration my gas chainsaw has so it is my choice of saws to use when cutting medium to small logs.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Gorney

customer_reviews.title: Really quiet and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Powerful and quiet. No gas required! Nearly as strong as a 50cc gas saw but quieter and starts every time. Just don’t cut through the cord!
customer_reviews.author: Monkey

customer_reviews.title: makita UC4051A chain saw 16bar in action
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, quick start every time, cuts good but not as fast. After cutting down about 4/5 trees it would need to disassembled, clean, then reassemble,,,, takes 4 mins. I recommend it !!
customer_reviews.author: theophilus elizee

customer_reviews.title: seems to have good power
customer_reviews.text: I droped two 24inch trees cut into two foot lengths just kept on cutting no problems I know thats not alot of work but ive cut enough wood to know im very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Maloney

customer_reviews.title: Electric chainsaw is best!
customer_reviews.text: Does a super good job at what it was designed to to do cut wood, I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: JayG

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: We have used this chain saw for a lot of trimming and it works very well and seems to be very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Runs quietly (for a chain saw) plently of power, chain does not automatically adjust however the adjustment is very easy to use. I originally a purchased a much less expensive saw that did not work out of the box. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: James Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Better than I expected. This is not Grandpas electric chain saw. It has some weight to it but not as much as gas chainsaws. Well built and functions well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Young

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality control
customer_reviews.text: Comes totally used cause they can’t catch that the average white male buyer for a saw like this has 1-2 big trees to cut and gives back the saw. Not touching it.
customer_reviews.author: TotallyNotRobots

customer_reviews.title: Quality saw
customer_reviews.text: The slow start feature is nice because it prevents the saw from jumping on the start. Chain tension is simple to adjust and holds tension well. A little expensive but worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: D. Zakarian

customer_reviews.title: Great until it breaks.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Mikita chain saw in less than ten years. Works fantastic until it breaks. Be sure to register it when new. One motor failed and next chain tightening mechanism broke. I am giving this brand one last try.
customer_reviews.author: Ray H.

product_meta.title: Makita Chain Saw, Electric, 16 in. Bar
product_meta.description: The Makita UC4051A 16" Electric Chain Saw is built heavy-duty for fast and efficient cutting with easy operation and maintenance.
feature_bullets: "Tool-less" blade and chain adjustments for convenient operation and easy maintenance
Rubberized grip handles are ergonomically designed for comfort
Large trigger switch with soft start for smooth start-ups
Built-in current limiter helps protect motor from burnout by reducing power to motor when saw is overloaded
Large oil reservoir with view window allows operator to check bar oil level

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars379 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
